creator: bellinghammakerspace
title: Gridding a picture... make any image bigger, smaller, or copy it.
materials_required: Straight edge (long ruler or stick or yard stick)
description: This project explains how to use the gridding method to copy an image, making it bigger, smaller, or the same size.
steps: Make a mark every 1" on all sides of the 8"x10" image, ensuring the marks on opposite sides line up.
Connect the marks on opposite sides of the 8"x10" image with parallel lines to create a 1" grid.
Label the columns of the grid with letters and the rows with numbers, ensuring that "1" and "A" are in the same square.
Make a mark every 2" on all sides of the 18"x24" paper.
Connect the marks on opposite sides of the 18"x24" paper with parallel lines to create a 2" grid.
Label the columns of the grid with letters and the rows with numbers, ensuring that "1" and "A" are in the same square.
One square at a time, draw what is in each square of the small grid into the corresponding square on the big grid.
